channel.title: Sony or Microsoft

Guys im posting this thread to tell you that Mopar is compatible with PS3
Leave a reply if it worked for you

IGN

Sony 'Rebuilding' PlayStation Network - IGN

Sony issued a statement saying it is "working around the clock" to bring the PlayStation Network and Qriocity services back online.

Xbox 4ever.

Xbox users don’t have any browsers… And xbox=microsoft=windows=live messenger=msn=bing=FU**ING SH*T![/quote]

item.title: Sony or Microsoft
item.dc:creator: @noobs_are_ftw noobs are ftw
item.description:
@noobs_are_ftw wrote:

[quote="|SITTION|, post:60, topic:391907"][quote author=laurent 248 link=topic=489074.msg3577213#msg3577213 date=1303512379]
Of course it works! ps3 is like a computer!

Xbox sucks 4ever!
[/quote]

like a computer, your so funny Pc can do wayyyy more then xbox and ps3 And yes… i got a xbox 360 and a ps3 both but they are not like a pc…[/quote]

actualy they are computers designed purely for gaming purposes with a custom operating system and its also possible to boot linux op systems on the ps3

en.wikipedia.org

OtherOS

OtherOS was a feature available in early versions of the PlayStation 3 video game console that allowed user installed software, such as Linux or FreeBSD, to run on the system. The feature is not available in newer models and is removed from older models through system firmware update 3.21, released April 1, 2010. Software running in the OtherOS environment had access to 6 of the 7 Synergistic Processing Elements; Sony implemented a hypervisor restricting access from the RSX. IBM provided an intro...

Read full topic

item.title: Sony or Microsoft
item.dc:creator: @AssualtX AssualtX
item.description:
@AssualtX wrote:

[quote=“CoonHunter, post:58, topic:391907”][quote author=AssualtX link=topic=489074.msg3580031#msg3580031 date=1303723132]

The Xbox 360 has the better operating system and software (ignoring games) on their system. The PlayStation 3 OS, while originally quite sleek and smooth - wasn’t designed to scale. As they’ve added more to the system, it has become slower, more complicated and fragmented.
[/quote]You wish jellyfish

Naa, he is right. Same thing happened to the PSP. These days, if you have a 1st gen PSP, your f’d as it only has 32MB ram. The 2nd gen and up all have 64mb, so its not that bad, but after the 6.20FW updates it has began to slow up a bit.[/quote]good point

Read full topic

item.title: Sony or Microsoft
item.dc:creator: @CoonHunter CoonHunter
item.description:

[quote=“AssualtX, post:56, topic:391907”][quote author=tL link=topic=489074.msg3579358#msg3579358 date=1303679364]
The Xbox 360 has the better operating system and software (ignoring games) on their system. The PlayStation 3 OS, while originally quite sleek and smooth - wasn’t designed to scale. As they’ve added more to the system, it has become slower, more complicated and fragmented.
[/quote]You wish jellyfish[/quote]
Naa, he is right. Same thing happened to the PSP. These days, if you have a 1st gen PSP, your f’d as it only has 32MB ram. The 2nd gen and up all have 64mb, so its not that bad, but after the 6.20FW updates it has began to slow up a bit.

Read full topic

item.title: Sony or Microsoft
item.dc:creator: @Mack_n_cheese Mack n cheese
item.description:
@Mack_n_cheese wrote:

[quote=“MistaBigBoss, post:24, topic:391907”]TBH, I don’t think it’s sony’s fault. We PSP fan boys (and PS3 fanboys) have the best hackers on our side, they worked REALLY hard and we did 5 years to get those fucking keys. Noone gives a shit about xbox so no wonder it has yet to be hacked.[/quote]I’m just saying,

  1. Are you ignorant, stupid or 5? Or all of the above?

  2. Hacking isn’t cool or anything to be proud of that you’re able to do. Mw2 on xbox 360 had over 10,000 hackers if i remember correctly. ps3 had a couple hundred true hackers.

either way it doesn’t matter though. i’m just saying

Read full topic

item.title: Sony or Microsoft
item.dc:creator: @tL tL
item.description:
@tL wrote:

Wait. People are saying the Xbox hasn’t been hacked?

Course it has. The xbox itself has been hacked for years, they haven’t had the same network problems (Though, does anyone remember the days of downtime a few years ago on xbox live because Microsoft couldn’t cope at Christmas?) and Microsoft have been trying to fight piracy on the platform for ages.

The browser on the PS3 is shit. It is only worth using when companies start to piss round with it to make their stuff work with it, like BBC iPlayer, 4oD, ITV Player, etc.

Just play the games. Its all that matters to a console because that is all they can do, get exclusive games - because neither of them will be the best at anything else.

Read full topic

item.title: Sony or Microsoft
item.dc:creator: @Tom Tom
item.description:
@Tom wrote:

MistaBigBoss:

TBH, I don’t think it’s sony’s fault.

Well, considering it isn’t their fault, who’s fault is it? You seem to like jumping to inadequate conclusions.

MistaBigBoss:

We PSP fan boys (and PS3 fanboys) have the best hackers on our side

Even though this statement is completely made up, how does it make PS3 a better console? If anything it would make it worse console as you would have a higher chance of your account being stolen and a higher number of games being cheated on.

Please explain to me how having these ‘elite hackers’ puts you at an advantage to other consoles. It obviously hasn’t done you any favors as of yet, has it? PS3 has become a well known console name in regards to being hacked.

MistaBigBoss:

they worked REALLY hard and we did 5 years to get those fucking keys.

This is another thing, which you seem to think makes PS3 a better console/community? How does an abuse, ungrateful community which throws a strop whenever they don’t get their own way signify a better console?

MistaBigBoss:

Noone gives a shit about xbox so no wonder it has yet to be hacked.

Yet again another assumption which you fail to backup with any conclusive points/quotations. Have you ever thought that the reason xbox hasn’t be hacked (server attacks wise etc…) is because it has a much more mature player base?

Hell, call me out on any of my points, I’ll happily respond.

[quote=“laurent 248, post:5, topic:391907”][quote author=Epic Steve link=topic=489074.msg3577225#msg3577225 date=1303513558]

Of course it works! ps3 is like a computer!

Xbox sucks 4ever!

At least Xbox users can sign in without getting an error message (80710A06).

IGN

Sony 'Rebuilding' PlayStation Network - IGN

Sony issued a statement saying it is "working around the clock" to bring the PlayStation Network and Qriocity services back online.

Xbox 4ever.
[/quote]

Xbox users don’t have any browsers… And xbox=microsoft=windows=live messenger=msn=bing=FU**ING SH*T![/quote]

Why would you want a browser in a console? Oh, I know, instead of using a computer which is a better option I’m going to use my console. Provide me a legit reason why you would rather sit at your TV instead of using an actual computer.

It’s just a sad attempt by Sony to try and be unique. Also, what does Bing have to do with Xbox? It’s not like the same people are making it.

relevant as they’re both consoles made from businesses on the OP. Please cut the "I <3 sony " posts, if you’re not here to actually put effort and care into your posts, then why post?

Read full topic
